intro: Glossophyllum ophioglossifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Ophioglossaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with a reddish hue. The plant produces sporangia in specialized structures called sporangial clusters, which are typically located near the base of the fronds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories across parts of Asia and Africa. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
